meanings.definition: Cause to feel shame or embarrassment.
meanings.sent1: She beshamed her friend by revealing her secret.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to beshame others to make himself feel better.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey beshamed the zookeeper by stealing his hat.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds beshamed the bright sun, hiding its light.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look beshamed the students into silence.

meanings.sent1: He beshamed himself by forgetting his lines on stage.
meanings.sent2: She beshamed easily, blushing at the slightest mistake.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy puppy beshamed itself by tripping over its own paws.
meanings.sent4: The old photo beshamed her, reminding her of her awkward teenage years.
meanings.sent5: The public speaking event beshamed him, making him stutter nervously.

meanings.sent1: The beshame in her eyes was evident after the embarrassing fall.
meanings.sent2: He felt a deep beshame when he realized his error.
meanings.sent3: The beshame of the situation made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The beshame of the defeat lingered long after the game ended.
meanings.sent5: Her cheeks burned with beshame as she apologized for the misunderstanding.
